oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of students of various local education institutions, a storm damaged Nashville street, and an Easter parade. Nashville Banner, 1927 May 1.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Boone, Lorraine; Rainey, Horace, Jr.
Nashville Banner
Students; Storms; Parades & processions; Theatrical productions
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of Scarritt College students, Tennessee School for the Blind students performing a play, Columbia Institute students at a Cherry Blossom Festival, Broad Street in Nashville, damaged by a storm, and a Knights Templar Easter parade to Immanuel Baptist Church. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Barr, W. E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
